activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas S Lawver

records.addlTxt:
1:30 PM 22CF82/22CF126 - Defendant Nicholas S Lawver in court.  Attorney Nicholas Frederick Gansner in court for Nicholas S Lawver.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  

22CF82 - Court speaks about the motion to revoke a diversion agreement. Court states that NL need to continue to make monthly payment of $100 per month. 
22CF126 - Attorney Gansner has received the complaint. Max penalties stated. Attorney Gansner waives the formal reading. 

Attorney Forehand asks that the motion be heard at the same time of the preliminary hearing if contested. Attorney Gansner states that they will be contesting this base on the text message only. 

Attorney Forehand heard regarding bail condition and contact with children.

Attorney Gansner waives the time limits for a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on December 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:35 PM Defendant Nicholas S Lawver in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. NL has received the complaint. NL speaks about an attorney he is working on getting.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:43 PM Defendant Nicholas Lawver appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Forehand appears in person.

States heard and asks for a $1,000 cash bond with the condition of "no contact with his wife or children."

NL heard.

Court orders $500 cash bond.
Conditions of bail are to be the same as  22CF82:
No contact with the victim, victim's residence, or the children, and to stay 5 miles away from the residence.
Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
